thread.title: Apple to Lease, Finance IPhone to Consumers for First Time
thread.title_full: Apple to Lease, Finance IPhone to Consumers for First Time - Bloomberg Business

author: Scott Moritz
title: Apple to Lease, Finance IPhone to Consumers for First Time
text:
Apple Inc. will lease and finance the iPhone for the first time, taking a cue from the nation’s wireless carriers in offering consumers alternatives for getting the latest mobile device.
The company’s “iPhone Upgrade Program,” announced Wednesday, gives users the option to upgrade to a new phone once a year for monthly payments starting at $32. The phones must still be activated by a carrier, the company said in a statement.
Apple’s leap into phone financing gives consumers another option to buy the latest iPhone at a a low monthly cost, similar to offers by Sprint Corp. and T-Mobile US Inc., while Apple’s leasing program lets customers upgrade faster.
The Upgrade Program could yield a sales boost of 5 million to 7 million more iPhones a year, according to Macquarie Securities USA Inc. analyst Kevin Smithen, who wrote about the possibility of iPhone leasing last week.
Apple will gain more control over the recovery and resale of used iPhones in the U.S. and internationally, and the carriers would be relieved of maintaining inventory of the devices, Smithen said last week.
The benefit of leasing is that consumers can trade in their phone for a new one after a year. With financing, consumers end up owning a relatively good phone at the end of a payment period and are less apt to buy a new one, which has put pressure on sales at phone makers.
